distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for libnbd is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Network Block Device (NBD) is a protocol for accessing Block Devices (hard disks and disk-like devices) over a Network. The libnbd is a userspace client library for writing NBD clients.

Security Fix(es):

* libnbd: Malicious NBD server may crash libnbd (CVE-2023-5871)

* libnbd: Crash or misbehaviour when NBD server returns an unexpected block size (CVE-2023-5215)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.4 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Unexpected Data Type

notes.text: A flaw was found in libnbd. A server can reply with a block size larger than 2^63 (the NBD spec states the size is a 64-bit unsigned value). This issue could lead to an application crash or other unintended behavior for NBD clients that doesn't treat the return value of the nbd_get_size() function correctly.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libnbd: Crash or misbehaviour when NBD server returns an unexpected block size
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libnbd: Crash or misbehaviour when NBD server returns an unexpected block size

notes.text: A flaw was found in libnbd, due to a malicious Network Block Device (NBD), a protocol for accessing Block Devices such as hard disks over a Network. This issue may allow a malicious NBD server to cause a Denial of Service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libnbd: Malicious NBD server may crash libnbd
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Libnbd 1.16.x and earlier are not impacted, these versions gracefully reject an extended response from a malicious server as unknown since they lack extended headers support.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: libnbd: Malicious NBD server may crash libnbd
